result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexis T. Nguyen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: --payment of costs, fees and surcharges, to include $150 drug testing fee joint and several with co-defendants
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent

--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription

--take any and all prescription medications only as prescribed by treating physician

--if permitted to travel out of State, no possession or use of marijuana(THC) in states where it is legal. No legal CBD products or other legal cannabis derivatives without express written permission of agent

--no contact with co-actors

--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent

--random drug screening

--The Court finds Ms. Nguyen eligible for special disposition/expungement.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexis T. Nguyen

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
[ma] Case called at 9:21am 
Defendant Alexis T. Nguyen in court.  Attorney Amber K. Rumpf in court for Alexis T. Nguyen.  Attorney Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; pleas of " GUILTY " entered on Counts #1, #3, and #4; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance is verified.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2

Sentencing recommendations/ arguments given by Counsel 

On Counts #1, #3, and #4, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--random drug screening
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--take any and all prescription medications only as prescribed by treating physician
--if permitted to travel out of State, no possession or use of marijuana(THC) in states where it is legal. No legal CBD products or other legal cannabis derivatives without express written permission of agent
--no contact with co-actors 
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--payment of costs, fees and surcharges, to include $150 drug testing fee joint and several with co-defendants

The Court finds Ms. Nguyen eligible for special disposition/expungement. 

Days credit for time already served:  3  days
recess: 9:48am
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

[ma] Cases 22CF217, 22CF216 called at 10:47 AM 
Defendant Alexis T. Nguyen in court.   Attorney Amber K. Rumpf in court for Alexis T. Nguyen. 
Defendant Roberto I Navarro in court. Attorney Daniel C. Nedset appears via zoom for Roberto Navarro.
Attorney Michael Witt in court for State of Wisconsin. 

As to Case 22CF217: Atty Rumpf requests a plea and sentencing be scheduled. 
As to Case 22CF216: Atty Nedset requests a status be scheduled. 

Scheduling is discussed. 

Atty Nedset may appear via zoom, Mr. Navarro is requires to appear in person
recess: 10:51am 
NEXT: As to Case 22CF217: Plea and Sentencing on 9/15/22 at 9:00am
As to Case 22CF216: Status on 9/15/22 at 9:00am

Pre-trial conference on July 20, 2022 at 03:40 pm.
Status conference on August 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.

[Court Reporter: Lisa Kwasigroch]
[ma] Case 22CF216 called at 9:14 AM
Defendant Roberto I. Navarro appears via zoom . Attorney Daniel C. Nedset appears zoom.   ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Zoom video conferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Court calls 22CF217, Alexis Nguyen at 9:16am 
Defendant Alexis Nguyen appears in court in person, with Attorney Amber Rumpf. 

Arraignment occurs in Case 22CF217:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

Scheduling of all cases discussed. 
recess: 9:20am  

NEXT:   As to Case 22CF216, Navarro: (1) Pretrial Conference on 7/20/22 at 1:40pm    (2) Status Conference on 8/5/22 at 10:30am (Atty Nedset allowed to appear via zoom)
As to case 22CF217, Nguyen: (1) Pretrial Conference on 7/20/22 at 3:40pm    (2) Status Conference on 8/5/22 at 10:30am

[ma] Case 22CF217 called at 1:40pm 
Defendant Alexis T. Nguyen in court with Attorney Amber K. Rumpf.  Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Ms. Nguyen waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Trial.

The Court calls case 22CF215, Emillion M Dominguez at 1:43pm
Defendant Emillion M Dominguez appears in court. 

SPD to continue effots to appoint counsel to Mr. Dominguez's case. 
recess: 1:45pm 

NEXT:  As to Case 22CF217(Nguyen)Arraignment on 6/17/22 at 9:00am 
As to Case 22CF215(Dominguez) Status of Counsel on 6/17/22 at 9:00am
Preliminary hearing on May 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Conditions of Bond include: 
--no contact with the Co-Defendants Emillion M. Dominguez, Roberto I. Navarro (*  Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
--no use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription

[MK] case called at 2:03pm 
Defendant Alexis T Nguyen appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Amber Rumpf (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
Attprney Rumpf verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.
The Court requires a $15,000 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no contact with the Co-Defendants Emillion M. Dominguez, Roberto I. Navarro
--no use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
recess 2:08pm. 

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on May 17th at 1:30pm
